intro: Melhania itampoloensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star apple, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces fruit that is typically green when mature, with a star-shaped appearance. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
